messages.message:
Hi team, I'm working with a long bank statement and trying to create one large table to extract all the info. A couple things here:
1. It's extremely laggy to define list attributes. Towards the end of the video, you'll see me wave around the cursor for a solid 30 seconds before the text that I typed show up. There's ~1000 rows extracted so understand the volume is large, but I feel we should be handling these better.
2. List extraction seems to be the best way to capture all entries across all pages, but it doesn't behave very consistently. From provenance, you can see that it extracts all of the information for most rows but not for others. Any other suggestions on how to accomplish this with the highest accuracy?

1. i see that the selected doc has over 100 pages - can you follow the instructions here (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1731443481379079?thread_ts=1731399890.667319&cid=C05BJCNKZAM) for turning off a feature flag?
2. what happens when you try to capture all entries via a table field or via a reasoning prompt? also, for your current list extraction field, can you share the descriptions for each attribute?
    a. cc @Vishnu
@david.lee did you try the table field? Did you have any issues?

@Serena @Hari I tried both before trying the list extraction and both weren't sufficient. Table field (maybe I'm not using this well) can't extract all tables reliably and combine them under one schema. Doc reasoning also can't extract all the tables

@david.lee Is this doc shareable? If so can you pass it on to us?

cc: @Rakesh @Atinder to debug the table field!
Not sure if we can. @michael.clark up to you

Hi @david.lee 
Can you share the project link and what prompts you were trying to extract with table field ?
Thank you @Rakesh and @david.lee for looking into this. Here is the link (https://aihub.instabase.com/build/0192fde2-c7e6-71e8-8fea-6475d1940e92) to the project in the SalesEng workspace
Here is the original PDF if that's helpful too
@michael.clark Assuming it's not real customer data
It is real, but we have an NDA in place with the company. Where is it going?
We will just be using a different build project on aihub with this pdf to troubleshoot why table field cannot be used and if there is a way to use that.
Great, that shouldnâ€™t be a privacy issue. Thank you for working on it
They are aware our team is testing with their documents
